intro: Galium olympicum, commonly known as the Olympic bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of the western United States. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. Galium olympicum is often found in rocky soils and alpine meadows, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions.
